description:
Delicious food, fast, for decent prices. I've been ordering from here for years and appreciate their quality and consistency. I've never had a bad dish. Our favorites / most regularly ordered: 

Basil eggplant with prawns and scallops,
Walnut prawns, 
Sauteed green beans,
Wonton Soup.
author: Amy W.

description:
DONT EAT HERE

My friend love this place so I followed. Site looks clean and menus are so professional. Good looks clean! I ordered Hunan chicken lunch special that was good. Also ordered dry braised chicken wings which was a mistake. All the braised Sauce covered up the old chicken taste. Didn't notice it until I got home later. We ate in and customer service stinks. The younger hosts served us but u can tell she was reluctant to give more than one glass of water, a little sugar for the tea and one napkin. Never offered more. I asked the male helper for a to go container. He didn't make eye contact and passed it saying here. It was dirty and I sent it back and asked for a bigger one. They gave me the same size. Lol!!! Plus I had to mix the wings with the other items. GOD BLESS THEM BUT SERVICE STINKS AND THE CHICKEN WAS TRICKY....
author: Ayanna W.

description: I go here often, they're nice and have decent chinese food. Nothing special kind of place but they don't have a bad dish.
author: Rohan D.

description:
General Tsos is on point! crispy and flavorful.

Schezuan beef was spicy and delicious with lots of veggies. 

The only things we wish are that rice wasn't an extra fee and that there were more types of veggies in the beef. It was mostly green pepper and my husband isn't the biggest fan of green pepper. 

I saw they have an awesome lunch special too so next time we may try that. 

Get the general Tsos! You won't be disappointed if you like sweet and crispy deliciousness. Great. Easy. Reasonable prices. Super fast. Pickup was no problem.
author: Alyssa A.

description: I really love the Shanghai tofu. Every dish I've tried has been good. Flavors are great. Ordering for pick up, I've always had times estimated accurately. Reiterating, the Shanghai tofu is my fav.
author: Edward F.

description: Good quality Chinese food. They have an award for their General Tso's chicken posted on the wall, I decided to give it a try and it's amazing! Good quality meat, lots of flavor and not too greasy. The place isn't very crowded for a Friday night either. I'll definitely come back to try the other items.
author: Marco J.

description:
It seems like this place either has really great reviews or really crappy ones. From reading other reviews, though, customers seem to have the most problems with take out delivery and language barrier.

I've eaten here three times now and I've been very happy all three times. Fast highlights: affordable (most dishes under $10), great portion sizes, quality and authentic Chinese dishes, no msg and food is not too oily, peaceful restaurant ambiance w piano music, dishes come out carefully and aesthetically plated, and they take good care of you in terms of service. 

Fast downsides: language barrier. The owner, Ming, is very nice. When I asked about the menu, though, I did experience some difficulty understanding what he meant. So that can feel a bit awkward. We ended up switching to Cantonese and had no problems after that. If you don't know Cantonese, though, just try to be patient and ask Ming to speak slowly or ask for another waiter. Sure we are in America, but I think pple should try to be kind and understanding regardless. 

Food experience in detail:
My first two times I ordered the Mongolian beef with rice and vegetables, a pretty basic standard Chinese dish. It was a bit heavy with the onions, but the portion size was pretty generous and the presentation was great. I would definitely recommend this option as a fast and basic it delicious dish if you're not sure what to order. 

My third time here, I brought my mom, so I wanted to pick out some more sophisticated Chinese dishes (as Asian moms are not easily impressed eating out, and my mom passes silent judgement on every dish that does not meet her expections..)
So, we ordered (and in order of my recommendation): 

1. West lake beef soup - a creamy, slightly salty Chinese soup that has some mushrooms, beef bits, and egg. It was nice and savory, and enough soup for 3 pple, definitely try this! Presentation of the soup was so pretty, it could have been in a food catalog. 

2. Garlic pea sprout - if you want a Chinese vegetable dish, try this! Pea sprout is usually more expensive at other restaurants but here it was reasonable. Portion size is great, not too oily, slightly salty and garlic taste. 

3. Vegetable spring rolls - yummy appetizer, comes out piping hot. Also I'm a sucker for spring rolls

4. Wild Pepper seafood basket - an assortment of seafood and vegetables (shrimp, scallops, peas, cucumber, mushroom, broccoli, carrots, etc) cooked together and placed into a crisp bowl-shaped pancake. Best part of this dish was the presentation. The seafood and vegetables were not burnt, was tender and not dry, and just the right amount of oil. The one bad thing was it was a bit saltier than necessary. 

5. Wild Pepper chicken - pretty good. There was chicken, bell peppers, mushrooms, cucumber, tossed together w a flavorful slightly salty sauce. Really yummy with rice. Comes spicy but you can adjust for less or more. 

I'm happy to say my mom was happy w the meal (disaster avoided!!) and our total meal cost was about $50 but we ordered so much we basically paid for two dinners for us both. All in all, will definitely be back.
author: Connie L.

description:
Nasty, greasy food. So greasy I could moisturize my skin and nails with it. And what's the deal with a food score of 72 out of 100 for 3 years in a row!!? That's disgusting!! Roaches in the soup, dirty bathrooms, defective plumbing, unsanitary food surfaces, improper food handling temperatures dirty walls, dirty ceilings, dirty floors and improper handwashing methods. I mean most Chinese restaurants are like that but at least they fix the problem after the first violation. 

Anything under 80 is dangerous! I'm saving you from food poisoning!! DO NOT EAT HERE!!!!!!! This is why good Chinese restaurants are expensive because the quality of food and the standards are higher. But I've even found expensive Chinese restaurants with food scores under 90. There is something seriously wrong with the Chinese food industry. Apparently when they open up restaurants in America they think it's like the back alley farmers markets in their native homeland. 

Stick to Panda Express even though it's fast food at least their score is always above 90.
author: Erika M.

description:
Satisfies American Chinese food takeout cravings; scores an 75% on grease scale. 

Can only comment on the food, which my friend ordered through Eat24. Based on our experience, would not seek to order again but would happily accept a plate heaped with Wild Pepper dishes.

- Chow Mein: standard chow mein, high noodle to stuff (meat, onions, peppers) ratio. Was an expected amount of greasy and didn't feel too heavy after (as sometimes happens with big noodle orders)
- Eggplant: ordered as a healthier veg alternative, but the pool of oil it arrived in made this dish run counter to my purposes...
- Beef on Snow: a semi-poetic dish name that disguises the crunchy mess beneath. This is the only dish I heartily would advise against ordering. 
Beef was battered deep fried to a point of rock-hard unchewability, set atop a bed of blistered green beans (fine), and doused in a mysterious white sauce (mayo?). In any case, we were just as unhappy as the beef (not really, but we weren't very happy).
author: Helen W.

description: Ordered this place on a whim, and was not disappointed. They have a great lunch specials, where you can get soup, fried rice/chow mein/or regular rice, and an entree' for $8! And it didn't make me run to the bathroom like some other "cheap" places. My office has ordered from them a few times now, and I haven't been disappointed.
author: Joey A.

description:
This is my favorite Chinese restaurant in the city The service is absolutely great and the food is delicious
I am very picky when it comes to my Chinese food
So when I want to order something Pacific they're always happy to make it for me and it usually comes out great and they even deliver which is really convenient
author: Robert S.

description: Menu had plenty of items marked spicy. I picked dry braised pork. Not spicy at all, and way too sweet.
author: Rob M.

description: So I ordered delivery tonight and it was purely disgusting I ordered Mongolian beef and king pow chicken. pretty normal dishes if you ask me the food was not edible it must be days old sitting in the corner of the kitchen somewhere. By far the worst Chinese food I've tasted ever I can't believe I wasted $25 on this garbage so I put it exactly where it belongs in the trash. MSG poison
author: Don R.

description: Dollar for dollar the best Chinese food I've had in San Francisco! The general Tao's chicken is golden brown and crispy, what more can you ask for. Awesome place to go to :-)
author: Brian P.

description: Chicken salad is ice berg lettuce and battered chicken with almost no sauce, BBQ  Pork is way over priced for A) The portion and B) The horrible sauce
author: Daniel B.

description: This has been one of my worst restaurant experiences so far. The Hong Kong style noodles tasted of nothing. The wild pepper chicken was just about average. But the worst was the Singapore style noodles: all they tasted of was tumeric. I am allergic to shrimp and had specifically asked for no meat, but the noodles came with shrimp as well as chicken, which had a weird red color to it. Luckily, I noticed the shrimp before I started eating it, else this day would have ended terribly for me. Will never be ordering from here again!
author: Shripad D.

description:
Beware the low Food Score...there is good reason for it.

In an effort to preserve my general well-being I stopped visiting this neighborhood restaurant. If you choose to visit, note this is greasy and mediocre Chinese at best.

As English is a second language for many in SF, some patience and understanding can only help you get what you want here. Also, delivered food takes some time and may not travel very well. You will have better results if you tried phoning in your order and picked it up yourself

I used to have their $8.95 Large (combination) Wor Wonton Soup. And, their $10.25 Kung Pao Chicken with its lots of veggies.

Currently closed for health code violations maybe they will take better care of what it is they serve their trusting customers.
author: Caesar A.

description: Love this spot! The chicken can be a little too batter-y but at this point this place is comfort food for me, and I come back often.
author: Adam K.

description: Wonderful first experience tonight! The owner was warm and inviting. For my first time, I asked what were his favorites. He recommended the Three Delicacies and it was a hit! The chicken, shrimp and scallops were seasoned perfectly! Such a solid dish when you want a lighter, less saucy option. Ambiance is great. Quiet, low light, soft music in the background. I will be back.
author: Larry G.

description: The dishes we ordered were so unpalatable that we had to throw them away. The hunan eggplant was soggy, the chow mein was horribly salty, and the meatless general tsos was so thickly fried it was difficult to chew. The dumplings were also over cooked. Very disappointing experience.
author: Marissa N.

description:
First time here and food was delicious. We ordered two different chicken dishes and both where exceptionally made. Will stop by again in the future. 
Pricing was REALLY good too, we had lunch specials.
author: Roman P.

description:
This is my favorite Chinese place in the Bay Area.

Yes it's "Americanized"

But the Tofu has great texture, it's spicy, flavorful, and you always leave full.

I can't believe this place is rated as low as it is!
author: Toby S.

description: The best lunch in SF under $8. The Kung Pao Chicken is a large and fresh serving, full of good veggies- zucchini, bell peppers, peanuts - and in a delicious savory sauce.  Nice presentation on a large ceramic plate with steamed rice and a small green salad, served with hot tea and (a very meh) egg drop soup. All for $7.55 plus tip.  Really very good, and plenty left over for tomorrow's lunch.  The only negatives: service is perfunctory and not very friendly. And the egg drop soup, as mentioned, can be skipped.  But this place is a great find, highly recommend!
author: Matthew L.

description:
3.5 Stars
Ordered through postmates. Totally adequate, greasy, Chinese food to calm the craving I had for Chinese food take out tonight. 

The beau and I ordered the combination appetizer plate, Mongolian beef, wild pepper chicken, and pork fried rice. There was no option in the app to request the dishes spicy so I called after placing the order to ask and--well, didn't go so well. Person who answered the phone didn't understand me at all and just kept saying "okay, your order?" 

Dishes didn't come spicy but we used sriracha for some heat. Best dish was a tie between fried rice and Mongolian beef. We have a TON of leftovers. I would skip the appetizers next time since none of them were particularly good. 

Okay in a pinch but nothing special here.
author: Semuteh F.

description: This was pretty average food I thought. The orange chicken was heavily breaded and dark meat. The Hong Kong style noodles were lacking in depth flavor. I also didn't like that delivery called me and made me go down to get it when we have an elevator and easy double parking allows zone. How lazy can you be? They confirmed they would adjust the tip but they didn't. Had to submit a complaint.
author: Piper W.

description:
Quick bites, a few tables, grab and go. $1 each dim sum, very fresh...great for to go. 
Don't expect a lot of talk... Know what you want or point!!
author: Pete M.

description: The one who's answering your phone is unprofessional and rude, he's mad and shouted at me when i dont understand what he is saying. Tell him to quit if he can't handle customers well.
author: Joel I.

description: My new go to place for Chinese food in the city. I was pleasantly surprised at the garlic chicken.  The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is lack of delivery option
author: Kim B.

description: BAD service, badly educated and rude Chinese, all lousy, took too long, ended my day. You can close the doors.  BAD BAD BAD BAD Service
author: Jaíne C.

description:
Kinda disappointed that I have to update my review.

Their health score made me want to eat dinner there but I gave it a shot. I made a wrong decision. I was eating my fried rice and there was a wad of plastic. I thought, must be a shrimp shell? Even though I ordered chicken fried rice...as I took a closer look, it was hard plastic. Very nasty. I stopped eating immediately. The fried rice wasn't good anyway, besides the plastic. Too much soy and too greasy. At least there was a good amount of chicken in it. But, that plastic is turning me away from here. I feel like that's something that should be noticeable. It looked like it was torn plastic. 

The honey walnut was 3 stars. Kinda didn't taste fresh but it was cooked very well. 

I think this restauraunt needs to focus on their health score and get it up. I gave them a shot even though it was low, and it doesn't look like the preps and cooks aren't mindful of what they put into their dishes. Very disappointed.
author: Lynn C.

description:
Wild Pepper has been my go to chinese delivery for years. Though it had been quite a while since I had ordered last.

Sorry to say, I was disappointed. The crab ragoons were sour, and wontons not crispy or crunchy. Like they been sitting around. Oh yeah, no trace of crab or krab. The honey walnut shrimp were barely warm and tasted "fishy" both of those cartons were open when I took the out of bag.

Anyway, disappointed but glad I had gotten the  Shumai. It was pretty good. I don't want another go to delivery spot and hope this was not a sign of future quality.
author: Sallie G.

description: This place is great!! Food is delicious, but I don't like when you come to a place and they just throw the menus at the table with out saying "hi". Other than that, this place is great!
author: Karla R.

description:
I stopped by Wild Pepper as we searched the mission for Chinese food. To be honest, looking at the reviews I thought this place will be bad. It isn't!
The food was really good, the service was good and the location is as well.

Nothing too exceptional but I like their Kung Pao chicken and fried rice. Their dumplings were average, but the meat and vegetarian meals are the way to go.
author: Jad A.

description:
Good for fast and cheap Chinese food. This place is the quintessential Chinese to go place (you can eat in but we always get it go to watch Netflix at home :) . 

Never had an issue and just pain tasty for a casual night.
author: Koko G.

description: Finally! Well priced Chinese delivery that isn't greasy and soggy! Everything was flavorful and delicious.
author: Kyle S.

description:
I love Wild Pepper! It's our easy Chinese takeout spot around the corner from our apartment. Now it's not ground-breaking delicious food, but when you're looking for a cheap, greasy Chinese takeout this spot is perfect.  We typically order 1 chicken dish (normally Sesame chicken), fried rice, and chow mein.  This ends up being enough for THREE meals for both of us (6 portions) for around $20-30 depending on if I have a coupon.  The only thing I haven't been crazy about that we ordered was the Mu Shu Pork - too much cabbage and not enough pork.  If you're feeling under the weather, the soups always hit the spot! 

Overall, if you're looking for a great affordable Chinese takeout spot in the Mission, Wild Pepper is a great choice!
author: Caroline T.

description: Really good food.  Amazing service.  Great location  wonderful vegetarian options.   Huge portions.
author: Tam M.

description: So yesterday my boyfriend and I tried having some wor wonton soup from Wild Pepper and we had a cockroach inside our soup. Not only did we have a cockroach, but we had dirty bowls and cups. On top of it all, they tried to make me pay for it and TRIED to take a picture of us without our consent. The highlight of it all was that the waiter wanted to bring me a "new" soup. No thanks buddy!
author: Monica R.

description:
I ordered Chinese broccoli, eggplant with prawns, hot and sour soup. 

The Chinese broccoli had absolutely no taste. 
The eggplants and prawn dish was loaded to brim with eggplant and no prawns. It also didn't taste great. 
The hot and sour soup tasted old? It didn't taste like your standard hot and sour soup. 

It really is easy to please me especially when it comes to Chinese food, but this place was so bad guys. Please don't order the dishes I ordered.
author: Cynthia G.

description: The Hot and Sour soup was delicious!  Delivered within a half hour. Exactly what I needed to cure me from the flu bug that has taken over my body.
author: Lynn S.

description: Hmmm, the Yelp page for Wild Pepper now says they don't delivery to me.  BUMMER!  It was wonderful while it lasted.
author: Kai T.

description:
Ordered delivery for the first time here tonight. The food bag burst and some of the food fell out and spilled as the delivery guy was walking up the steps. He was so awesome- he went back to the restaurant and grabbed us more food , and was back in 20 minutes. Awesome service!!

Plus so yummy
author: Al P.

description:
Ordered orange chicken and chicken garlic w a side of rice and white meat chicken in both dishes.  Total was $23.90 w free delivery.  Good food for the price, orange chicken was all meat and tasty but seemed a tad dry.  Garlic chicken was too subtle on the garlic w plenty of veggies.  Be sure to ask for condiments, 2 meals only came w one packet of hot sauce, one hot sauce and one fortune cookie.  Will likely order again.
Update:  after posting this, owner responded to me and indicated they will be sure to provide extra condiments for to-go orders :)
author: Scuba J.

description:
3.5 stars

Wild Pepper makes a fantastic first impression: a spacious corner building, seemingly clean, & visually appetizing food served on heavy, quality dinnerware.

We ordered a couple appetizers & a couple lunch plates: 
-- Fried wonton interestingly had chopped pieces of BBQ pork rather than ground pork. 
-- Eggplant in garlic sauce was tender & delicious, after I scooped off the excessive, gloopy garlic sauce. 
-- I enjoyed the corn & egg drop soup but not the hot & sour one. 
-- My order was a bust because I chose white rice to go with the eggplant & general Tsao chicken (which had a strong five spice seasoning I didn't care for.) Lucky for me, bf is generous with his food because I kept stealing forkfuls of his fried rice, which was so nicely flavored. (I can't recall which pork dish he chose...) #FriedRiceEnvy

Decent lunch prices, MSG isn't added to food, very nice servers...I'd consider returning, but would try different menu items.
author: Fancypants X.

description: Had food delivered on a Sunday afternoon, it took over 1 1/2 hr. for it to arrive.  I ordered two items, the won ton soup and ants up a tree.  Both were horrendous, the soup broth tasted like soy sauce a water, the won tons were just won tons with a very small amount of filling, VERY SMALL.  Ants up a Tree was just OKAY.   Wouldn't order here again.  BYE Wild Pepper you SUCK!!
author: jeff a.

description:
So not order from this restaurant!!!! I was charged twice, owner hung up twice and was extremely rude.

Food was disgusting.
author: leah p.

description: Truly awful.  Dishes aren't as described in menu.  Vegetables were mealy, sauces were corn starch laden, seafood like little pieces of tasteless rubber, buckwheat soba an overcooked lump of gluten.  Even the rice was poorly done.  To be avoided at all cost.
author: David M.

description:
I used to order from here often. Sadly I'll never do it again. 

I placed an order through the Yelp app. Clearly stated "Not spicy" and my food was so spicy I couldn't eat it. I even had my friends try it (ones that handle spice better) and it was even too hot for them. 

I called to ask for a refund since I spent $20 on two orders and they said they could only credit me for half. I was also told that the manager was too busy to speak and they would process the refund later- I have still not been given my money back.

What made this even worse was that I had to call them two times to see where my food was. I waited 1.5 hours for food that I couldn't eat. 

Horrible service. Wouldn't recommend ordering from them, especially via the app.
author: Gina H.

description: Great food and fast service, even on a stormy day when  I had just moved in. I had the orange chicken and curry beef with a side of avocado spring rolls that were delicious. Overall great experience- I'll have try others dishes in the near future!
author: Jony V.

description: Good food and friendly service. I had the mongolian beef and walnut prawns. Very tasty with good texture. Will come back to try other items on the menu.
author: Justin V.

description: A staple lunch time place!  The lunch plate menu is always satisfying.  Try the fried won tons!
author: A E.

description: I've been to Wild Pepper twice and simply loved it each time. Last time we had crispy beef, Shrimp Chow Mein, Chinese broccoli with tofu, I think the sweet and sour chicken, and the combo appetizer. Every dish was perfect. Just perfect. Exactly what each of us wanted. And it was Christmas eve, just before we went to a movie. We were all so perfectly delighted. Our servers were kind and speedy. The place is warm and comfy. Not fancy, just comfortable. If I lived closer I'd be here every single week. I love every part of this place.
author: David A R.

description:
Was hoping for more...

Heard some good things about this place so we decided to try it out on a whim. Parking might be rough but we got lucky and was able to park right in front. Inside it felt clean and neat. Decorated nicely and inviting. No complaints on that at all. 

The food. We ordered the Westlake soup, avocado rolls, and mushroom chicken with a side of rice. First the avocado rolls, it was okay. This was probably my favorite out of the bunch. Its fried like an eggroll but has veggies and tofu inside. Pretty good. Second that we liked was the Westlake soup. More soupy than we are used to. Lots of beef and veggies but the thing that threw us off were the diced water chestnuts and the amount of ginger that was in it. The ginger was cut julienne style so tough to pick out. Lastly was the entree, the mushroom chicken. That had even more ginger julienne style and it was almost over powering the dish. We tried to separate as much as we could but it was futile. Enjoyable, but the ginger...

Overall the food was kind of bland, which isn't bad... I'd prefer that than loaded with salt or MSG and the amount of ginger was kind of much. But the food really wasn't bad. It was just OKAY.
author: Jay V.

description:
The food is delicious. But delivery takes 1.5-2 hours. I've tried three times in the last 6 months - always the same. 

By that time the food is ice cold. 

And they estimate the delivery is 45-60 minutes. That's quite different from 1.5-2 hours. 


We tried again a few days ago and it only took one hour.  When the food arrived it was still warm.  I appreciate your comment and efforts.
author: Stacey R.

description: This place deserves far better ratings!! Amazing hole in the wall Chinese restaurant, everything I have ordered has been DELICIOUS! I love their Hong Kong style noodles, beef fried rice & my boyfriend loves their Tao chicken. This place is our go-to Chinese restaurant!
author: Timmi C.

description: They have an award for their General Tso's chicken posted on the wall, I decided to give it a try and it's amazing! Good quality meat, lots of flavor and not too greasy. The place isn't very crowded for a Friday night either. I'll definitely come back to try the other items.
author: Jacob M.

description:
Just ordered through Eat24 & the delivery was free ! Overall rating, I'd say 3.5 stars. It took an hour for my order to come. I got the salt & pepper squid, crab rangoons, potstickers, & white rice. The squid wasn't fried the way I expected it to be but it wasn't bad. The crab rangoons were delish ! Potstickers weren't exactly my fave. But it was an overall good, cheap dinner. 

Note: Didn't like how the guy wanted me to give him a cash tip when I could easily do it through the app. He ended up asking me if I wanted to tip 10% or 15% so he could do it for me ? I just went w. 10%.
author: Michelle L.

description:
I decided to try Amazon's food delivery service since they were offering a $10 off promotion for using their service for the first time and came upon this restaurant. I'm a pescaterian and don't eat meat so I decided to order one of their "meatless chicken" dishes. 

The order came and I took a bite not second guessing anything and trusting the restaurant to get my order right. It tasted just like chicken and checked my order to make sure I ordered the "meatless chicken" dish. Once I confirmed that I did I just figured they did a really good job of making a dish that tasted just like chicken. I continued to eat the dish and then after taking some more bites something didn't seem right and I examined the pieces of "meatless chicken" come to find out it was REAL CHICKEN!!!! 

This is something a restaurant should not mix up and I was devastated that I ate meat!!!! They need to be very careful what they are making and to not give real chicken when someone orders the meatless. I can never trust them and I will never order from this restaurant again!!!!
author: Sarah L.

description: Meatless Kung Pao the best I'm addicted to it great choice for vegans who love that spicy taste of course with a side of rice bomb
author: Marta V.

description:
The Lemon Chicken is very starchy and dry.
House special chowmein , Salt & Pepper Pork Chop,
Combi Foo Young , Kung Pao Chicken , Hot & Spicy Egg Plant are good...
my order was delivered in an hour..typical on a dinner time
author: Maria R.

description: My favorite go to Chinese Delivery.  The food is seasoned very well and they don't skimp on the meat. Delivery using the Eat 24 App gets to my place way before the time given.  My favorite dishes are the Generals Chicken, Fried Brown Rice and the Cashew Chicken.  They also provide Chinese spicy oil without having to request it.  I've ordered the chow mein as well which is non greasy and tasty.  Avocado egg rolls were also great.
author: Will C.

description:
Wild pepper is the perfect place for solid dependable Chinese food on rainy nights or take out days. The crab Rangoons are made with imitation crab meat and are delicious! 

Hot and Sour soup is a great portion for the price and is also a good choice.

Can't go wrong with Shrimp dumplings. Would Def come back.
author: Chhaya N.

description: Wild pepper is a great local joint. Its menu holds tons of classic dishes and I am rarely disappointed by the food. My favorites are the orange chicken and honey walnut shrimp.
author: sally w.

description: They have Hong Kong crispy noodles! My favorite Chinese dish. We ordered it with veggies and tofu. Really crispy and delicious!! Will definitely order it again next time. Cozy, casual spot- perfect for a rainy evening meal.
author: kim p.

description: Great place to eat. Delicious, cheap, and portions are huge. The tall Asian guy is hard to understand but other the that a 5/5
author: Lucero C.

description: I absolutely love this place the best Chinese food in town highly recommended everything is unbelievable
author: Victoria A.

description:
Got takeaway for Monday lunch and it was exquisite. We had the general tso's chicken and the Szechuan spicy chicken lunch dish and the chicken chow fun. 

The servings are massive and I was worrried at first cos the reviews were so bad about the hygiene and service but I think we picked a good day cos the food was delivered pretty fast to us in 30mins. Easy as. 

The quality seemed fresh as well! 

Packing was nice too :) 

Yum yum yum the general tso's chicken was the highlight and the Szechuan chicken dish!
author: Ester K.

description: Definitely one of the best chinese in the area that delivers also. Some nights they're a little off, especially when it's busy. But when they're on, it's good.
author: Chelsea E.

description: Ordered takeout from here last week and the food wasn't very good. Ordered five different items and long story short--it all tastes the same; like it's all cooked in the same oil. Just a bit greasy and most items quite bland in taste. One of the dishes, Szechuan crispy beef, was incredibly chewy (and not in a good way) and it had more breading than anything. There was plenty of food leftover, but unfortunately we did not end up going back to it because it didn't reheat well and it just wasn't tasty. Definitely avoiding ordering takeout from this place again.
author: Justin P.

description: This place has some really delicious food. I order the chicken fried rice, General Tao Chicken and War Wonton Soup. Everything tasted fresh and light. None of the food was greasy.  Found them on yelp
author: Andre D.

description: Good American Chinese food. Sometimes packed, so call ahead or do delivery. Love the walnut prawns and crispy chicken (general Chow's I think)
author: Rachel L.

description: Not happy with my delivery. Usually my food comes at least somewhat hot. This time it was barely warm. Flavor was still ok but still doesn't make up for the lukewarm food.
author: Kristine S.

description: Whenever I crave Chinese food this is the first place I would come to because their place is very clean. Food is worth the price. Service is good as well. I just love how they cook their food perfect and it is not too oily or anything. Presentation is good.
author: April M.

description:
Pretty much the only decent chinese food place around the mission area (no, Mission Chinese is not real chinese food!). The crispy noodles, roast duck, and curry beef are all pretty accurate renditions.

Don't forget to order rice, since it's usually not included in the dishes!
author: Henry L.

description: Experience unfair and racist treatment I was told that all black people complain and send the dishes back and they no longer wanted to do business with me I've been eating  there for 10 years and the food used to be good, but the servers always acted as if they never wanted to help me.  The Mongolian beef was disgusting it was so tough I could not chew or digest it, It was prepared  poorly. I asked them to give me a different dish I was told okay but when the server spoke to the manager he said he didn't want to do business with people like me black people always complain and always send food back I wouldn't go to this restaurant ever. Bad customer service and unfair racist treatment.
author: Lori J.

description: BAD restaurant health report; wish I had read it before ordering from this restaurant. They delivered the WRONG food; food was greasy and didn't taste fresh.  They also lathered thick gooey sauce over the food. They put the hot greasy food on top of the Hong Kong CRISPY Noodles which resulted in a soggy, not crispy noodles (Most GOOD restaurants put crispy noodles in a separate container). We will NOT BE ORDERING from this restaurant again.
author: Carolyn M.

description: Waited almost two hours for cold Chinese food. The restaurant wouldn't even answer the phone. Found two hairs in my food.
author: Vani A.

description: I personally am a huge fan of their chicken chow mein, definitely my go to place for showmen. However the reason for the 4 stars is simply because I have gotten a stomach ache from their orange chicken. Other than that I love the place.
author: Rosabella P.

description:
I'm not racist. However, I truly believe that if you're going to operate a service based business in the US, then you should have more than a rudimentary understanding of the language. Now, I understand that even english speaking food preparers are capable of mistakes but, nowhere NEAR the amount of mistakes that occur when I order Chinese food in this town. It's amazing. If you just order what's on the menu, you're usually fine. but GOD forbid, you ask for a change. 

In this case, I didn't even ask for a change. I just asked for Pork fried rice. The first thing out of the box? A prawn. I don't have a shell fish allergy, I just find them repulsive but, if I did, I'd be dead now. 

The "Cashew Sauce" was absent of cashews and was in essence mayonnaise. I nearly threw up. 

That said, it WAS a lot of food.
author: Robert M.

description:
First and foremost, note that this 3-star review does not mean this place sucks.  Far from it.  It's truly "A-OK"--how Yelp defines 3 stars.  Having said that...

1. The best thing going for this restaurant:  The owner Ming Louie.  Courteous, laid-back, and I think genuinely interested in his customers' experience.  Whether or not you might have had back luck with the food or the service on your encounter with Wild Pepper that counts for a lot in this business.

2. Other things going on for this restaurant:  Great low-key location near the main drag (Guerrero or Valencia), but far enough away for you to be able to enjoy the comfortable indoor setting. Great vegetarian options that are fortunately pretty tasty too.  I wish the broccoli wasn't so over-cooked on my General Tso's meatless chicken, but the fake chicken had a nice texture and flavor to it.  Not too spicy, but a present kick.  More sesame seeds please!  If you like your vegetarian chow mein to be crispy like I do, this place is it.  Great flavor and crunch I'd expect from Hong Kong style chow mein with a good amount of adequately cooked zucchini, broccoli, pea pods, carrots, bok choy, and white mushrooms.  

3. Why I'm short of being a 4-star "fan" (for now):  There is an awkwardness about the social skills of the staff I encountered that does not match Ming, the nice setting, and the decent food.  Having noticed the poor Yelp feedback of the delivery service, I decided to phone in my order and pick it up.  The young lady on the end of the line was, in addition to being hard to hear and understand, was a little curt.  After hearing my order, no "did I get order right;" no "thanks & good-bye;"  no "your order should be ready in about X minutes;" no space left for me to ask a question; just "click" (from the phone hanging up).  

Folks, as the saying goes, "There's no second chance to make a first impression."  My first impression came the minute I picked up the phone for my order.  That having flown out the window, I'll still probably give Wild Pepper a few more shots, knowing that the owner is well-meaning and that his establishment serves up decent vegetarian Chinese food (albeit, slightly modified for the American palette).  Should I become a "fan," expect to see the number of stars go up!
author: Paolo M.

description: Great taste and generous portions. Top 5 fav Chinese deliveries in the city for sure
author: Roshan G.

description:
Average Chinese food.

There were a few hiccups throughout the night. Our vegetarian sizzling rice soup came out with seafood in it. Our plates and chopsticks were pretty dirty, I think they need a new dishwashing machine. The waiter brought me brown rice instead of white rice which isn't a big deal, I still ate it, it just wasn't what I ordered.

It might be family owned restaurant, I'm glad they were all having a nice time talking in the back. Unfortunately this made the owner(?) seem rushed during all his interactions with us. No one came back to refill our water, and we had to hunt someone down to get our check. Chinese restaurants aren't known to have great service, but I'm still underwhelmed.
author: Sarah N.

description:
I had the kung pao chicken and beef chow mein delivered tonight. BOMB AS F***!!!

The dishes may be greasy American-Chinese takeout, but the flavors are authentic to Chinese cuisine. I'm so excited to have finally found the best of both worlds at Wild Pepper. I'll be back for sure!
author: Maida C.

description: Ive been eating here for over ten years and they have been consistently great! The Mongolian Beef has been one of my favorites!
author: Victoria M.

description: I am From teochew, chef does too! Eat it last December! Was pretty great! Nice service! Can't wait to try it again! Goose is the best thing
author: Chun L.

description:
Place is bomb.  My baby brother lives out in the Mission while hes in med school and eats here 3 times a week.  Came here with him, mom, and grandma to see what the hype was all about. 

Parking: was pretty awful on a Saturday night, had to park 6 blocks away after we dropped the ladies off first.

Service: was great. The girl server was cute and pleasant. My mom and grandma both speak Cantonese so I have no idea what was happening all of them were laughing and talking for a decent amount of time. I wish I was bilingual, damn you suburbs.

Ambiance: Had a really cool general's costume on the wall next to your table. Nothing crazy and a kinda small restaurant. There were about 12 tables and 6 were taken. 

Bathroom: That. Sink. Tho.

Food: Got general tsos and honey walnut prawn. Both were very crispy and juicy with the perfect amount of batter and sauce. 

My grandma owned a restaurant in Chinatown in the 50s and 60s and we had a pretty funny conversation during dinner:
-Grandma: *bites into chicken* Man this is good chicken, what's the name of it again?
--Me: General Tso
-G: Who's that? We never served this in my time.
--Me: I dunno, maybe a famous guy or some Americans just made it up
-G: Hmm, oh well it's still good 

Chinese grandma approved
author: Eric B.

description:
Absolutely love this place! Would give it 6 stars if I could. Everything we've tried on the menu is delicious (recommend the walnut prawns and beef chow fun) and the service is always friendly and prompt. Usually I call in for pick-up, but have had great experiences when I've dined in.

The lady at the front desk cleared an extra table for us even though there were two large parties in the restaurant and even remembered our exact order from our last visit two weeks prior.
author: Agustin G.

description:
Found this place on the DoorDash delivery site...so my review here is based on my experience with the food.

Delicious!

My choices included veggie fried rice and Szechuan chicken. The fried rice was full of flavor and packed with veggies and not greasy at all.  The chicken was super spicy but oh so good.

I'll definitely order from this place again and try some new things.

Enjoy.
author: Wendy P.

description: We decided to try this place because it popped up for vegetarian options, and was fairly close to where we live. The first guy we talked to was able to communicate in English and seemed to understand what we wanted. We ordered delivery,and he told us it would be delivered within 45 minutes. After an hour and a half and no food, I called back to see what was going on, and got a girl who didn't understand English and couldn't answer any of my questions. The delivery guy finally showed up 20 minutes later.  The bill was $32, and I gave him two 20s and was going to give him a small tip from the change, but when I asked him to just give me a few bucks back, he kept saying, "Is OK?" and couldn't communicate at all except to say that, so I let it go, but resolved never to order from them again. The food tasted like it had been sitting in his back seat for the whole two hours--stale, cold, the grease a little rancid. Maybe it would be better if it wasn't delivered, but don't know if we'll ever be ready to take that chance. There's plenty of way better Chinese food in San Francisco.
author: Jim H.

description:
Amazing Place!
- Amazing food! 
- Lots of veggie and Vegan options! 
- crazy fast service!
- reasonable prices
- they serve free tea

Only thing that keeps it from 5 stars is the language barrier. Sometimes they struggle to understand you which leads to wrong orders :(

Overall highly recommend!
author: Johnny C.

description: We ordered delivery from postmates, one of the worst deliveries ive ever had. Warning the potstickers are deep fried. The lettuce wraps are awful and beef broccoli we not edible. Do. Ot wast your time with this place
author: Dee D.

description: Food was really good! Their menu is confusing cause apparently I got from the lunch menu and there is no lunch menu on sundays so idk. However the food itself was pretty good I'd definitely go back.
author: John C.

description:
4th time ordering from here. This time I went in person for pick up. Solid Chinese take out. Good flavors and generous portions. Love it.

--- Past--

Ordered through Amazon Prime Now app. The food was really good especially for it being delivered, delivery was about 10 minutes early, and the portions were very generous. We will visit the store one of these days to try everything fresh off the wok/fryer/stove.
author: T M.

description:
Something about inexpensive chinese food that's so close to home amazes me. The owner is very kind and we always get soup with the meal whether or not we dine in or eat take out or delivery.

Braised chicken wings are so delicious. Saucy and crunch and just the right amount of spice (that you can choose)

Fried rice is nice and flavorful with soy sauce as I love it.

General Tsao's meatless chicken is unexpectedly amazing! The reviews are so on point here. I don't know how it isn't real chicken but it tastes so good. Great for those that don't want to chew very hard on tough meat. It's very soft and flavorful.

Egg drop soup is one of my favorites and I've gotten it served to me probably 4 out of the 7 times I've been there now.

Great location in the Mission.
author: Amanda N.

description:
I ordered delivery tonight and was completely unhappy for several reasons.

1. I ordered for delivery because I couldn't leave my room babysitting 6 kids. Although I am in walking distance to many restaurants (staying in financial district/union square), I went for this place because of the delivery option.

*Delivery took OVER an hour*

When the driver arrived he had me walk down to get the food, instead of bringing it to my room. If I knew this, I would have ordered food from the cafe downstairs. 

2. I requested for extra Siracha, forks and spoons. I got no forks or spoons, no napkins, 1 small cup of the oil pepper sauce and two packets of soy sauce. We ate with our fingers. Wild Pepper, even people in prison get forks and spoons. smh -_-

3. I ordered the Vegetable Chow Mein, the chow mein was drenched in oil, there were literally 2 huge pieces of broccoli and 1 piece of Bok Choy. The General Tsao Chicken tasted like basic chinese fast food orange chicken (the super sweet, fried, etc).

I ordered two items plus 2 sides of Brown Rice with tax and tip, a grand total of over 25 dollars.
author: Tiff Y.

description: Ordered delivery through the yelp app - pretty good! Came in about 35 mins, and delivery itself was free! Good food, and pretty satisfied overall.
author: Madan M.

description:
Me and my girlfriend's FAVE Chinese food spot!

We're vegan and love how accommodating this restaurant is to us. We come so much the staff knows us and they are always super friendly.The food is delicious and we've brought tons of friends and family here and they all love it.

We always get General Tsao's Meatless Chicken. That is our ultimate favorite.  A little spicy, a little sweet, perfectly delicious every time. It's a Must Get! Even the meat eaters love it. 

For veggies, we get the Dry Sauteed String Beans (yum!), the Hunan Eggplant is pretty good and if you feel like curry, the Indian Monk is a yellow curry with veggies and Chinese mushrooms.

But, everything is yummy and consistent. We've also had Kung Pao Meatless Chicken, Dry Braised Meatless Chicken, Salt and Pepper Meatless Chicken, Five Flavor Meatless Chicken (similar to General Tsao's but get General Tsaos!), Veggie Chow Fun, Jalapeño Fried Rice (no egg) and prob tons more I cant remember.

If you're feeling meatless chicken is too heavy, they have a section called Health Food Section where its your choice of different steamed veggies, your choice of a protein and you can pick your sauce.
author: Jenn S.

description: This place is a wonderful hidden gem in the city! Always fresh on Served just right. The owner is sweet as pie and very generous of spirit. This is the type of business that makes SF special.
author: Ronald B.

description:
Wow!  Hands down that this is the best Chinese restaurant in the Mission.  I had the spicy eggplant and chicken and I must say it's probably the best eggplant dish in the City.  Nicely located between Guerrero and Valencia on 26th St. and not congested like other parts of the Mission.  It was my first time eating here and the waitress, Alice recommended the eggplant dish and simply put, it was fantastic!  This is truly a little gem.  I will be back soon to try their other dishes.  As I was leaving, I was fortunate enough to meet the owner, Ming....extremely friendly and I must say he takes pride in his cooking.   

Thanks Ming!  I will be back soon.
author: Sam M.

description: I have been back to Wild Pepper for lunch on four or five occasions since our first visit. We really like this place. It's unhurried, but yet attentive, the food is always delicious and the service is circumspect, the way I like it to be. (Yes, they will come back to freshen your water glass, but they won't bug you.) It is one of the quietest restaurants you can hope to find. Bring your loved one or your friends, you won't be disappointed. This is not your "elite" Chinese restaurant, but yummy, plentiful, and always served with a green salad. I though this was very odd, at first, but i kind of like it. I get my fresh greens!
author: Albert K.

description:
Food was ok 3.5 stars... Delivery time was not. 
I'd ordered the food to be delivered at a certain time (90minutes out) the original estimate was that it would come in ~60minutes. 15minutes after my scheduled delivery time passed and there was no word from the restaurant i called them (it was new years eve and they were very busy) they told me it should be ready in another hour! =Nearly 3 hours after i'd placed the order. 
In the end it arrived 30minutes later (45minutes after the scheduled delivery time).
author: Isa N.

description:
The on-line menu is great and really easy to use!  I was happy to see healthier choices listed there too.  I opted for the steamed vegetables and chicken.  You have a choice of several sauces that you can add to this dish.  I chose a brown sauce.  We also ordered the BBQ pork fried rice and an order of sweet and sour pork.
There are fields on the menu for you to make special requests like "no MSG", or "not too spicy" etc.  I thought that was a great idea to add there.
The food itself was not bad.  I need to try different items next time because what I ordered may have been a little too healthy.....boneless, steamed, white chicken and steamed vegetables.  
The fried rice was really salty though--too much salt!  
It's worth experimenting with the menu a bit more next time.
author: Thomas D.

description:
I've been here several times within the past few weeks now. It has become my favorite lunch spot based on location, price, and variety of the menu. I discovered they actually have two different types of meatless chicken. One for fried dishes, General Tso's, Orange, Sweet n Sour, etc. Another form of meatless chicken that looks like brown tofu but tastes different for the other dishes like Szechuan, Kung Pao, etc. Being a junk food vegan, I prefer the texture of the fried but the cubed chick is pretty good too. I tried to ask my Chinese buddy which dishes were fried vs non fried, but he's more redneck than I could ever hope to be. There's a good reason his nickname is "Tex"... 

I still can't give it a full 5 stars since fake chicken is the only vegan option they have so far. Although even if there was a fake beef, I'd probably still opt for the chickenish dishes. They're also not the fastest place in town. Which isn't  a problem for the most part since we usually call ahead, although I still have to wait sometimes. Also the Monk's garden Soup was not what I was hoping for. Almost no flavor at all. Not disgusting or anything. Just needs some salt, MSG, or something. Would probably be good a starter instead of a full meal. I'm already looking forward to my next meal here later this week.
author: John B.

description: Ate here during my visit to San Francisco with my family and or friends. We found this place randomly on Yelp and let me tell you , WOW! Probably the best Chinese food I have ever eaten. I came back to LA missing the taste!
author: Alisa T.

description: I was so disappointed to come back to my favorite restaurant and find out that they added to dishes that did not need to and the quality of the food use to be better walnut prawns. walnuts added with sesame seed over powers the walnuts it was not a candied  walnut like it's supposed to  be rice under seasoned and undercooked veggies in the rice  also new brand of fortune cookies don't taste as good as the old brand
author: Erin W.

description:
This place is a solid place for casual, low-key, tasty, and inexpensive Chinese food.

We enjoyed the mixed vegetables with chicken, chili fish, and chicken chow mein.  The crab egg flower soup, however, was bland and disappointing,

The service was polite and efficient.

We went on a Saturday night, and the place was mostly empty (I expect take out / delivery account for most of their business).  The decor was nice.

Overall, a good find.  Not out of this world, but definitely hits the spot when you're craving good, old fashioned (American) Chinese food!
author: Barnali D.

description:
I was feeling Chinese food, so decided to come here with my boyfriend. At the end of the day, we were both extremely full with a lot of left overs to bring home. We ordered 4 entrees and was only able to finish 1/3 of each because the portions were huge! We ordered General Tao chicken, dry braised chicken wings, salmon with asparagus, and garlic pea sprouts, all very delicious and highly recommend!  
The restaurant itself has dim lights with red/orange walls to complement the Chinese art pieces; very good choice of interior design compared to other Chinese restaurants! 
Servers were quick and polite. The owner, Ming, was very friendly and took the time to converse with his customers. He made sure we were satisfied with our meal and kept checking back on us! 

Overall, very satisfied with our experience and definitely coming back here again!
author: Jessica L.

description:
Husband ordered yesterday because I was too sick to cook. He got:

Woh won ton soup
Mu shu chicken
Pot stickers
General tsao's chicken

He ate all of the soup last night and said it was great. I skipped dinner due to typhoid or whatever this is.

We had leftovers tonight. We are talking about old Chinese food... And wow, it was pretty darn good. So I'll bet it was REALLY good yesterday.
Ok I lie. The potstickers were deep fried, so they were probably never very good. Everything else? Yay.
author: El B.

description:
We were looking for some inexpensive Chinese that took credit card and was open late.  Wild Pepper fit the bill.   We ordered a hot and sour soup, vegetable delight, and the Wild Pepper meatless chicken (after reading numerous positive reviews of it).

Overall it was decent and hit the spot at the time.  The hot and sour soup was good.  Nicely spicy and not too salty.  The vegetable delight was great, nicely sauteed vegetables, nice and light.  The Wild Pepper chicken was okay, a little salty and greasy, not bad but I think I would just order normal chicken next time. 

Met the requirements.  Fast and hot delivery.  Thanks guys!
author: Nick G.

description:
This is one of the best restaurants in San Francisco. My rating is going to be based on four categories. Food, service, atmosphere and price. 

The ingredients here taste like they were picked from a garden in the back of the restaurant. Everything is fresh as can be and the mix of flavors are some of the tastiest I've ever experienced. I like eating plant based food and Wild Pepper has textured, flavored, soy that they call meatless chicken. It is FANTASTIC!!! My favorite dishes are Wild Pepper meatless chicken, tomato beef chow fun, vegetable wonton soup, avocado spring rolls, onion pancakes (their peanut sauce is thicker and tastes much better than creamy peanut sauce), and green tea ice cream for dessert. Try the General Tsao, Broccoli beef, Kung Pao and Vegetarian Delight entrées as well. 

I always tip 25% here because the service is constantly superb. Ming, the creator and owner, puts his heart and soul into this business. It's easy to tell his culinary experience by the quality and diversity of Chinese cuisine he serves plus his management experience is evident in how well the restaurant operations are run. The staff is extremely friendly and kind, always helping before I ask for assistance and listening to everything I and my friends ask for. John and Alice specifically do an exceptional job keeping me happy and expressing interest in friendship with me, which makes me very happy. The chefs always do an exceptional job listening to even the smallest of details to ensure customer satisfaction which always makes people happy knowing they are being taken great care of. 

The ambiance here just perfectly brings me into Chinese culture, even though I'm in the Mission district of San Francisco. They have soft cultural music playing, historic decorations on the walls and on the floors and an exceptionally clean venue. They incorporate plants into their ambiance as well which I love because it brings a more natural feel. 

The appetizers are priced around $5 and the entrées around $10 which are extremely reasonable because the portions are HUGE!! I am a big man who eats a lot of food and I can barely finish one $10 entrée which turns into a second meal later in the day or the next day, so I end up paying $10 for two delicious meals which I love doing!! In terms of San Francisco prices, this is an absolute jem because normally I would be expecting to pay closer to $15-$20 for the same entrées. 

All in all, I hope my review has better helped you understand why Wild Pepper is a must dine in San Francisco. The combination of high quality food, phenomenal service and ambiance as well as great price is difficult to find in San Francisco and Wild Pepper does them all and more. Thank you for reading and I hope to hear about your experience at Wild Pepper soon! :)
author: Allen S.

description:
Our go-to Chinese Delivery place around the Mission! My not-so-infrequent Chinese food cravings are always SO effectively satisfied by the General Tsao Chicken. I have been fairly lucky with the delivery thus far. In fact, there have been times I've called 5 minutes before closing time and still got prompt service. 

P.S: Typing this review while waiting for the order!
author: Divya A.

description: The bbq pork dim sum was pretty good. My entrée however, i had to throw away. I ordered the meatless sweet and sour and was only able to choke down 2 pieces of it. The tofu is breaded WAY too heavily, and just turns into this chewy, mushy dry ball.
author: Katie B.

description:
Ordered some foods through yelp. Took about an hour for the food to get here but I expected the wait so it was okay. 

I will start with five stars since the foods were good. 

However,
1. noodles were burnt!! Quarter of it was thrown away and noodles tasted burnt. Unacceptable!
2. No free fried rice tho I ordered three entrees! :/
3. Delivery guy lingered a bit and looked like he wanted tips. (I already tipped through yelp account)
author: Esther P.

description:
Really good! We ordered for Delivery the shrimp with vegetables and they were not greedy with the shrimp. It had a good flavor!

thank you!
author: Marylou V.

description:
We ordered takeaway from here last night and it was really good. We had the curry beef, chicken double mushroom (although not sure why it's called that because it had hardly any mushrooms in it but it still tasted good), vegetable fried rice and some spring rolls. The food tasted really fresh and you could tell it didn't contain MSG. It only came to $21 too so really good value for money. 

Only comment to make is don't order through the 24 eat site it offers because it's slow and keeps crashing. We called our order in, in the end.
author: Kelly M.

description: Only giving three stars to them based off food and pricing . Ive ordered here multiple times for both me and my employees . My work location and the restaurant are fairly close to each other in downtown sf. All times that I have ordered was for more than 1-3 meals which then take a minimum of 1.5 hours when I'm contstantly told it's "maybe an hour". First order ever took 2 hours yet I still order giving them second chances. Not only does the delivery take long but each time the driver still bluntly asks for a tip and when explained they took more than an hour he still proceeds to ask why. Food good price ehh service and delivery hell no
author: Jeffrey A.

description: i ask the tall chinese guy in glasses for extra glass of water. i overheard him saying "mahai = mother's cunt or vagina. (chinese slang)" as he walking back to the kitchen after i request for my water. im not sure if that's a good thing for people who understand chinese or he doesn't like his job period. food = american chinese. customer service at its finest! my second and last time thank you!
author: JessePanda C.

description:
So I happen to be driving down the street one day and this cute restaurant caught my attention with the most amazing aroma coming out of it. I said I'll be back. A few days later I was craving Chinese food and decided to go back. 
As I'm pulling up, that same amazing aroma caught me and I couldn't wait to get some food. I go inside, very clean, cute and quite but there was no host. So I stood for a second and finally this girl comes out the back and acknowledges the guys that were sitting down in the waiting area but does not acknowledge me. She fiddled around with papers and whatever else and still no acknowledgement. So I say to her "hi, can I order some food to go please." She responds "yea" and walks off. She comes back, brings one guy his order and walks back to the back. A few minutes later she comes back with the other guys order hands him his order and walks off again. So I'm standing there and I'm on the phone with my mum whom I'm ordering food for as well. So she comes out the back again and we make eye contact and I smile at her and say hi again and she walks off again to the back. She comes out with a pitcher of water and begins to fill the guest who were seated in the restaurants water glass. So now I'm getting irritated, and the only reason I didn't leave is because my mum really wanted this food. So she comes out again and I say to her "is there a problem?" And she responds "no" and pulls her note pad out to take my order. The whole time I stood there with she seemed uncomfortable and as if I was a bother to her. All the back and forth from the back were long waiting periods. She never said thank you or anything pleasant to me. 
I finally get my to go order, make it to my mum's job to have lunch with her and our order was wrong. The Mongolian beef was delicious but my shrimp fried rice was completely messed up. I wanted no egg in the rice due to allergies, but all I got was shrimp and rice. I did want my vegetables. 
So the food was good minus the mishap with my fried rice but the service was horrible! I couldn't help but feel a certain way as the host was nice to certain types of people but short and not friendly with me. 
If you decide to go here it's going to be a gamble I assume.
author: Dion A.

description: General tsao chicken is crispy, meaty and savory. It's like the four seasons of diabetic Americanized Chinese food
author: Dane O.

description: The staff are friendly, the food is neither too greasy nor salty, and there are plenty of vegetarian options including vegan chicken (a gluten and soy protein mix).  Two of us shared an entree and apoetizer and that was perfect.
author: Daniel C.

description:
I've ordered from here before, but have never reviewed it.

This is between a 2 and 3 star review for my most recent delivery tonight.  I docked down a star for the wait time on the delivery - 90 minutes from order time, on eat24, as suggested by so many.

We ordered: General Tsao's chicken, dry sauteed string beans, crab rangoon, avocado spring rolls, dry braised chicken wings, and walnut prawns.

After 90 minutes of waiting, the food arrived tepid.  The fried batter of the rangoon and prawns had withered and cooled.  The avocado spring rolls were bland, lifeless, tasteless, with brown avocado.  The dry sauteed string beans had sat in the container for enough time that condensation had built up and made them soggy.

In terms of taste, the crab rangoon, avocado spring rolls, and dry sauteed string beans were nothing to write home about.  Pretty uneventful, soggy yet dry.  The walnut prawns at least had some sauce.  They were decent.  The chicken wings had a lovely coating that saved that whole plate.  It was ordered medium spicy but didn't taste like there were any chilies in it.  Finally, the General Tsao's chicken was the best dish of them all.  It had sauce, was at least a little spicy, and wasn't cold.

I'm reluctant to reorder from here because it feels like it's so hit or miss.  Maybe going in would be a better bet?
author: Rebekah C.

description:
This place is epic! The food tastes fresh, the restaurant is clean, prices are reasonable and most importantly the food is finger licking good!!!!!!
My cousin brought me here and right away we were greeted by owner. The owner was very nice and was ready to cater to our needs. He spoke with us, made some recommendations and had some good laughs. 
The food is amazing...Szechuan beef!!! General Tsao chicken or tofu....amazing....volcano prawns...for those who love sweet and spicy!!! 
I need to try the dry braised chicken wings, honey walnut prawns and everything else. 
Also the menu is interesting, the menu explains all the styles of which the food is cooked, very helpful. I've only been three times to eat at this location, but I plan to attend more with my wife and twins!!!
author: Adrian P.

description: Ordered delivery and although it was fairly quick my order was wrong and the delivery man was extremely rude. I didn't even eat my food because it wasn't like they forgot a veggie I added or something. It didn't resemble at all what I ordered. If I could get a refund I would. So In short not eating here again wouldn't recommend it either.
author: Jacqueline G.

description: A week ago I ordered two 2" hotel Pan of the general Tzao chicken for a retirement party, to pick up on Thursday January 26! 2017  at 11.30 but when I called them to verify if the order was almost ready the cashier stated that he did not understands me and hang out the phone. I was very disappointed with his remarks therefore I Went there to pick up the food and they told me that do not accept credit cards only cash.  However when I placed the order I paid $100 with credit card. What a liars ?  Anyway the general chicken was dish did not have enough meat Mostly brad. What a rip off to the hard working people. To conclude the cashier is very rude and food is terrible . Please do not order the general tzao  chicken because is mostly bread.
author: Carlos C.

description:
Been ordering takeout here for years, as it's close by and tasty. It's also a good place to dine in if you're local to the area. 

Unfortunately, I've noticed inconsistencies with how I've been charged (some days I pay $1-$2 more for the exact same order). My roommate has experienced the same thing. Perhaps ordering on Grubhub might resolve that issue to keep the pricing consistent with what you see on the menu.
author: Jonathan G.

description: I always like to try out new places and this was my first time ordering here so it may not always be like this, keep an open mind, but my experience was not the greatest. We ordered the combo chow fun, which was not the best I've had. It was very dry and had no flavour. Broccoli beef was alright. Beef a little on the chewy side and the broccoli was cooked thoroughly. The honey walnut prawns which is supposed to be a chefs special was okay. It definitely had a weird taste to it but manageable if you decide to order it. Food shouldn't be just manageable though. We also got the crab rangoons which was surprisingly very good. Had flavour, well-portioned inner bits, and a perfect crunch. I'd order those again. The BBQ pork steam buns was pretty bad. The bun tasted like I was eating plastic. The pork was dry. There wasn't any flavour and it was bland. Overall I've had better. The price is not worth it. I won't be back for this place, I'll spend my $$ elsewhere, but I'm glad I gave it a go so I won't be wondering what their food is like anymore. For a general recommendation, find another Chinese place. This one is worth the pass up.
author: Chelsea I.

description:
Will not order from here again.

1.  The delivery driver was 40 minutes past the 1 hour promised delivery time.  As a result, all of the food was lukewarm at best, some pieces completely cold.  

2.  The Mongolian beef I ordered was mostly leeks and onions.  Very little beef, and what was there was so chewy I could barely eat it.  Maybe it becomes harder to eat the colder it gets while sitting in the delivery driver's backseat.

3.  The BBQ pork was chewy to the point I had to spit out parts of it just to choke it down.  Also, COLD.  

4.  Crab Rangoons:  COLD.

We chose this place on a whim.  We will never order from here again.  Worst $46 I've ever spent.  I went to see the Britney Spears' movie in high school and got more for my money just on stale popcorn and performances.
author: Jess T.

description:
came on the strength of other yelpers' reviews but it didnt seem they were talking about the same place... got lunch here, a couple of rice dishes  which were supposed to come with a bowl of soup.. (their lunch menu), but i guess they forgot the soup.

the rice dishes were not spicy at all, lots of sauce on the general tso's chicken, and the spicy pork rice was suppose to be spicy,   not...

nice comfortable place but not wildly peppery... not even slightly
author: dee c.

description: A nice Chinese restaurant. very big portions.
author: Daniel L.

description: After having a horrible first day in San Fran we found this little gem. We ordered orange chicken, white rice and egg rolls for delivery. It was delicious. The sauce was almost like an orange marmalade. It was so tasty and each piece of chicken was HUGE. Definitely recommend this restaurant. Dont eat in China Town (per locals) eat here (per me)
author: Lindsey R.

description: I have only gotten their food as delivery. In general, I have been really pleased. The best Chinese delivery if you're south of Bernal Heights. Make sure to ask for napkins and utensils and sweet and sour sauce.
author: D D.

description:
This neighborhood Chinese place is worth the search for a parking space. The food was tasty with plenty of veggie choices for the vegetarians in our group. The staff was nice and attentive. We ordered so much food, I have no idea what to suggest here (we literally filled the long table we were at) but there were no disappointing dishes. 
If you are in the mood for Chinese and are in the area, you should definitely eat here.
author: Dawn R.

description:
4:15pm: Placed an order here a while ago. Guess I'll "live Yelp" my experience.

4:45pm: Food arrived. It was $30. I gave the delivery guy $40 and he just turned around and started to walk away! Rude. I had to ask him for some change. Is that a thing, unilaterally deciding your own tip and walking away? Minus one star.

4:47pm: The Szechuan Buddha looks promising. I see black fungus, tofu, green beans, broccoli and bean curd skin, among other stuff. The sauce is okay but I wouldn't call it "spicy," as they have.

4:49pm: The Szechuan Meatless chicken is exactly the same dish as the Szechuan Buddha, just with meatless chicken instead of bean curd skin and black fungus. The mediocrity of this sauce is much more apparent now. Definitely rolled the dice and lost on this one.

The meatless chicken pieces are small and lack the mouthfeel of better meatless chicken, like the kind they use at Crazy Pepper. The texture is spongier, too, which wouldn't be such a big deal if they weren't just soaking up more of this mediocre sauce.

5:05pm: The Wild Pepper Noodle is just okay. Some might call these egg noodles mushy. 

5:07pm: Struggling to discern a meaningful difference between the flavor profiles of any of these dishes. The meatless chicken has no real flavor so it tastes literally exactly like the Szechuan Buddha dish; the "chicken" adds nothing. The Wild Pepper Noodle is super whatever.

5:10pm: I enjoyed a potent spliff before this meal and still can't seem to eat more than a bowl and a half of it.

5:14pm: Is my game done installing yet?

5:14pm: *Pokes last piece of meatless chicken in the bowl*

5:17pm: Ugh, wait what? That was just the setup process and now there's 2 hours left of install time?? *exits Final Fantasy: A Realm Reborn.* I can't deal with this shit. *starts Fallout 4.*

5:19pm: Crap, there's still food in my bowl but I don't wanna eat it, which isn't like me at all. This was such a waste. I feel guilty now. I'll eat it for lunch tomorrow, promise.

5:26pm: I feel like this meal was a metaphor for my relatively crappy 2015, bad decisions included, and now I'm sad. Will 2016 suck too? How did one crappy meal send me into a tailspin about the trajectory of my entire life? *inhales spliff* Was this meal so bad that it literally made me depressed? Fuck.
author: Jay S.

description: Ordered for delivery. Was missing item(s) (even though receipt was checked off by someone to "make sure" order is correct). Ordered through eat24 and will file complaint through them. Also, delivery man needs to work on his crass attitude (you give me tip now makes me not want to tip you at all: tip-smile and be friendly!)
author: Anna P.

description:
Love this place for delivery! Everything is always fresh, hot and delicious.

Sad that they're charging a delivery fee now, even with orders way above the minimum. Nevertheless its still worth it.
author: Angelique M.

description: I often order from here when I work nearby on the weekends. I like the food. I have no complaints there but, usually when I call my order for delivery, the guy that answers the phone is nearly impossible to understand and sometimes I'm not sure if it's the same guy or not but they are a bit rude. I don't know if it's intentionally or just the way they talk. Maybe a cultural thing? When I eat there in person they seem nice-ish.  I would give a higher rating if they had better customer service skills.
author: Jess Y R.

description:
General tso's is quite tasty. Be sure to order a side of rice because it doesn't come with any. Crab rangoons are decent. I'm not a great judge.

Edit: just moved up to the city and found you on yelp. I'm sure your diver will be seeing more of me ;)
author: Brodie G.

description: Orders take out late on Monday night. Other places closed at 9pm but Wild Pepper was open so we tried the veggie moo sho and meatless General Tsao's chicken. Worst moo shoo I have ever had. The pancakes were dry and tasteless. General Tsao's sauce was tasty but again tasteless and spongy texture. Couldn't even finish it was so bad. Will never order here again. Too many choices for good Chinese take out in Mission area.
author: Pairadoc S.

description: Love the chicken wings and the sweet and sour pork, but not the tall guy with glasses. He serves like a zombie, the girl with ponytail serves better.
author: Ryan S.

description:
Best chinese in the mission. Delivery is always super fast and friendly and the place itself is clean. Love the hot and sour, twice cooked pork, pan fried hong kong style noodles with beef and the general tso's chix. 

yum yum nom nom.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Excellent food paired with reasonable price.  Went there once or twice for the past few months. We left the place with happy stomach every time.
author: Ri W.

description: Have lived within a few blocks of this place since it opened. I can say that it is reliable, delivery is usually very prompt, and they have a killer sizzling rice soup. The potstickers are a little disappointing, but all of your standard go-to American-style Chinese food choices are here and reliably good. I love the "health food" section where you can essentially build-your-own chinese food by starting with steamed veg and choosing protein and a sauce. I have pretty much never had a really disappointing meal from here. I do miss the weird and wonderful cold shredded potato salad thing they used to offer. It's also a decent choice when you have a vegan in your party. Also: portions are very generous. It's a good value.
author: Brooke B.

description: I ordered for delivery of grubhub the food was really fresh I was pleased. I will definitely be eating there again
author: Latrice M.

description: This was a yelp fail.  Ordered 2 simple dishes on a Friday night at 5:15.  I was told they would be delivered in 40 minutes.  They were delivered an hour and 10 minutes later, lukewarm, super greasy, and spilling out of the sides.  The food was just ok, and very greasy.  Will not eat here again.
author: Lyn W.

description: It always bugs the hell out of me when the employees are trying to rush people because they want to go home early. WHERE ARE THE MANAGERS AND OWNERS?!? The ambience seems way better than most, but this is a take-out place for me. The prices are a bargain, the food is solid and they knoock it out fast.
author: James G.

description:
Ok I literally am writing this review as I eat my Kung Pao Chicken which was just delivered to my office. This is DELICIOUS!  Such a beautiful array of fresh vegetables--never had so many veges in this dish before. I will definitely be ordering from this place again! !
I've just tried my coworker's  general tsao chicken and the crab rangoons. Also Yum!
author: Gabriella P.

description:
Solid food for delivery.

Salt and Pepper vegetable balls are addictive.
Fried Tofu with basil was refreshing and tasty.
Vegetable Chow Mein solid too (how can you mess this up?).

Delivery was on time, reasonable price for food and it was stlil warm.  No complaints except for the Broccoli with Garlic Sauce Salad...not very good!
author: Sanket K.

description: This is an update based on using their preferred ordering site. The food is delicious, and when ordered through eat24hours.com came on time and without extra charges. DO NOT order through www.wildpepperchinese.com or you will pay a delivery charge and it may take hours to arrive!
author: Molly S.

description:
One the Best china Food The best thing going for this restaurant:  The owner Ming Louie.
Delivery the shrimp with vegetables and they were not greedy with the shrimp. It had a good flavor!
author: Belter P.

description:
I usually eat at Alice's but they don't deliver. I tried wild pepper but it's not that great and I won't eat there again.

One measurement of the quality of any restaurant is ingredients. This is a Chinese restaurant that uses bags of frozen cubed carrots and peas in their dishes. Sauces where bland and oily. After a few bites my kids refused to eat it.. The vegetable chow main had almost no veg in it at all and the sizzling rice looked watery and clear. Lesson learned, pick up from Alice's is much better and worth the drive across town.

If you think this is great five star chinese, you need to try more restaurants. There are some great 4-5 star chinese restaurants in SF.
author: Jeff C.

description: This is my first time ordering from Wild Pepper. I really wanted Chinese food at work tonight. The pot stickers were fried instead of steamed. I prefer steamed but the pork filling was tasty. My Hong-Kong style noodles with chicken was delicious and full of noodles, chicken, bok choy, carrots, zucchini. The portions are plentiful which was a very pleasant surprise!
author: Sheila T.

description:
Food was fantastic. 

Ordered: 
Wild Pepper Chicken - Peppery and flavorful. Tons of vegetables which may not be for everyone, but good balance for me. 

Chicken Chow Mein - A bit dry, but very good and huge portion. 

Combo Fried Rice - I asked for this spicy, and they actually did make it spicy! It was delicious. 

Black Mushroom and Bok Choy - I LOVE mushrooms, and my wife and I really enjoyed this. Very saucey so especially good with rice. 

Overall - definitely worth the order, and will def be a go to for Chinese in the Mission.
author: Anush V.
